title.narrative: Strengthen the Readiness and Response Capacity of Republic of Korea Humanitarian Actors to Disasters in the Korean Peninsula

description.narrative: The Republic of Korea (ROK) has a strategic importance in sustaining peace and security in the Asia Pacific region. Instability in the Korean peninsula will have direct spill-over impact in the region where many of the world’s largest and emerging economies reside. The activity aims to capitalize on the previous capacity-building program and continue the support for strengthening the readiness and response capacity of the ROK civil society and government actors to both man-made crises and natural disasters in the Korean peninsula through strategic capacity-building interventions, ultimately contributing to the localization of the quality emergency planning and delivery beyond the scope of this proposal. Interventions will include customized trainings in thematic topics in humanitarian assistance, targeted knowledge curation and dissemination, partnership-building and facilitation of cooperation among domestic and international humanitarian actors in the country, and awareness-raising and advocacy activities for wider stakeholder groups within the ROK humanitarian community, inclusive of organizations involved in domestic, overseas and the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea assistance. Interventions will be designed and provided to address specific needs of different target groups which are largely fragmented and show greatly different knowledge and capacity levels in disaster preparedness and response.
